18.verse: And in thy zera shall kol goyei ha’aretz be blessed; because thou hast obeyed My voice.

19.verse: So Avraham returned unto his servants, and they rose up and went together to Beer Sheva; and Avraham dwelt at Beer Sheva.

20.verse: And it came to pass after these things, that it was told Avraham, saying, Hinei, Milcah, she hath also born children unto thy brother Nachor;

21.verse: Utz his bechor (firstborn), and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,

22.verse: And Kesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Yidlaph, and Betuel.

23.verse: And Betuel fathered Rivkah: these eight Milcah did bear to Nachor, Avraham’s brother.

24.verse: And his pilegesh, whose name was Reumah, she bare also Tevach, and Gacham, and Tachash, and Maachah.

1.verse: [CHAYYE SARAH] - And Sarah was an hundred and seven and twenty shanah old: these were the shnei chayyai Sarah.

2.verse: And Sarah died in Kiryat- Arba; the same is Chevron in eretz Kena’an: and Avraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.

3.verse: And Avraham stood up from before his dead, and spoke unto the bnei Chet, saying,

4.verse: I am a ger and a sojourner with you: give me an achuzzah (possession) of a kever with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.

5.verse: And the bnei Chet answered Avraham, saying unto him,

6.verse: Hear us, adoni: thou art a nasi Elohim among us; in the choice of kevareinu bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his kever, that thou mayest bury thy dead.

7.verse: And Avraham stood up, and bowed himself to the am ha’aretz, even to the bnei Chet.

8.verse: And he spoke to them, saying, If it be your nefesh (will) that I should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intercede for me to Ephron ben Tzochar,

9.verse: That he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his sadeh; for the kesef maleh (full price) he shall give it me for an achuzzah (possession) of a kever amongst you.

10.verse: And Ephron dwelt among the bnei Chet: and Ephron the Chitti answered Avraham in the hearing of the bnei Chet, even of all that went in at the sha’ar of his city, saying,

11.verse: Lo, adoni, hear me; the sadeh give I thee, and the cave that is therein, I give it thee; in the presence of the bnei ammi give I it thee; bury thy dead.

12.verse: And Avraham bowed down himself before the am ha’aretz.

13.verse: And he spoke unto Ephron in the hearing of the am ha’aretz, saying, But if thou wilt give it, now, hear me; I will give thee kesef for the sadeh; accept it from me, and I will bury my dead there.

14.verse: And Ephron answered Avraham, saying unto him,

15.verse: Pay heed, adoni, unto me; the land is worth four hundred shekels of kesef; what is that between me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.

16.verse: And Avraham paid heed unto Ephron; and Avraham weighed to Ephron the kesef, which he had named in the hearing of the bnei Chet four hundred shekels of kesef, according to current merchant value.

17.verse: And the sadeh of Ephron which was in Machpelah, which was near Mamre, the sadeh, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the sadeh, that were in all the borders round about, were deeded

18.verse: Unto Avraham for a property in the presence of the bnei Chet, before all that went in at the sha’ar of his city.

19.verse: And after this, Avraham buried Sarah his isha in the cave of the sadeh of Machpelah near Mamre; the same is Chevron in the eretz Kena’an.

20.verse: And the sadeh, and the cave that is therein, were deeded unto Avraham for an achuzzah of a kever by the bnei Chet.

1.verse: And Avraham was zaken (old), and well stricken in age; and Hashem berach (had blessed) Avraham in all things.

2.verse: And Avraham said unto his eved zekan of his bais, hamoshel (that ruled) over all that he had, Put, now, thy yad under my thigh;

3.verse: And I will make thee swear by Hashem Elohei HaShomayim and Elohei Ha’Aretz, that thou shalt not take an isha unto beni of the Banot HaKena’ani, among whom I dwell:

4.verse: But thou shalt go unto my eretz, and to my moledet, and take an isha unto beni Yitzchak.

5.verse: And the eved said unto him, What if the isha will not be willing to follow me unto HaAretz Hazot: must I needs bring binecha back unto ha’aretz from where thou camest?

6.verse: And Avraham said unto him, Beware thou that thou bring not beni to there!

7.verse: Hashem Elohei HaShomayim, which took me from bais avi,and from the eretz of my moledet, and which spoke unto me, and that swore unto me, saying, Unto thy zera will I give HaAretz Hazot; He shall send His Malach before thee, and thou shalt take an isha unto beni from there.

8.verse: But if the isha will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be released from this my shevu’ah (oath): only do not bring back beni there.

9.verse: And the eved put his yad under yerech Avraham adonav, and swore to him concerning this matter.

10.verse: And the eved took asarah gemalim of the gemalei adonav, and departed; for all the goods of adonav were in his yad: and he arose, and went to Aram Naharayim, [Mesopotamia] unto the Ir Nachor.

11.verse: And he made his gemalim to kneel down outside the Ir near a be’er hamayim at the time of erev, at the time that women go out to draw mayim.

12.verse: And he said Hashem Elohei adoni Avraham, now, send me success this yom, and show chesed unto adoni Avraham.

13.verse: Hinei, I stand here by the ayin hamayim; and the banot anshei haIr come out to draw mayim;

14.verse: And let it come to pass, that the na’arah to whom I shall say, Let down thy jug, now, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy gemalim drink also; let the same be she that Thou hast appointed for Thy eved Yitzchak; and thereby shall I know that Thou hast showed chesed unto adoni.

15.verse: And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, hinei, Rivkah came out, who was born to Beituel Ben Milcah, eshet Nachor, achi Avraham, with her jug upon her shoulder.

16.verse: And the na’arah was tovat mareh me’od, a betulah, neither had any ish known her: and she went down to haayenah (the spring), and filled her jug, and came up.

17.verse: And the eved hurried to meet her, and said, Let me, now, drink a little mayim of thy jug.

18.verse: And she said,Drink, adoni: and she hasted, and let down her jug upon her yad, and gave him drink

19.verse: And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw for thy gemalim also, until they have done drinking.

20.verse: And she hasted, and emptied her jug into the trough, and ran back unto the be’er to draw, and drew for all his gemalim.

21.verse: And the ish gazed at her and held his peace, so as to have da’as whether Hashem had made his derech prosperous or not.

22.verse: And it came to pass, just as the gemalim had done drinking, that the ish took a nezem zahav (gold ring) by weight a beka, and two tzemidim (bracelets) by weight ten [shekels of] gold for her wrists;

23.verse: And said, Whose bat art thou? Tell me, now: is there makom in the bais of thy av for us to spend the night?

24.verse: And she said unto him, I am Bat Beituel Ben Milcah, the ben which she bore unto Nachor.

25.verse: She said moreover unto him, We have both teven (straw) and mispo (fodder) enough, and makom (room) to spend the night.

26.verse: And the ish bowed his head, worshiped Hashem.

27.verse: And he said, Baruch Hashem Elohei adoni Avraham, who hath not left destitute of His chesed and His emes; I being on the derech, Hashem led me to the bais achei adoni.

28.verse: And the na’arah ran, and told them of her bais em these things.

29.verse: And Rivkah had an ach, shmo Lavan; Lavan ran out unto the ish, unto the ayin.

30.verse: And it came to pass, when he saw the nezem and tzemidim upon the wrists of his achot, and when he heard the words of Rivkah his achot, saying, Thus spoke the ish unto me; that he came unto the ish; and, hinei, he stood by the gemalim at the ayin.

31.verse: And he said, Come in, Baruch Hashem; why standest thou outside? for I have prepared the bais, and makom for the gemalim.

32.verse: And the ish came into the bais; and he unloaded his gemalim, and gave teven (straw) and mispo (fodder) for the camels, and mayim to wash his raglayim, and the raglei haanashim that were with him.

33.verse: And there was set ochel before him to eat; but he said, I will not eat, until I have stated my business. And he said, Speak on.

34.verse: And he said, I am eved Avraham.

35.verse: And Hashem hath blessed adoni me’od; and he is become prospered: and He hath given him tzon, and bakar, and kesef, and zahav, and avadim, and shefachot, and gemalim, and chamorim.

36.verse: And Sarah eshet adoni bore ben to adoni when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.

37.verse: And adoni made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take an isha for beni of the Banot HaKena’ani, in whose land I dwell;

38.verse: But thou shalt go unto bais avi, to my mishpokhot, and take an isha unto beni.

39.verse: And I said unto adoni, What if the isha will not follow me.

40.verse: And he said unto me, Hashem, before Whom I walk, will send His Malach with thee, and prosper thy derech; and thou shalt take an isha for beni of my mishpokhot, and of my bais avi;

41.verse: Then shalt thou be released from this my oath, when thou comest to my mishpokhot; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be released from my oath.

42.verse: And I came this day unto the ayin, and said, Hashem Elohei adoni Avraham, if now Thou do prosper my derech which I go;

43.verse: Hinei, I stand by the ayin hamayim; and it shall come to pass, that when haAlmah [haAlmah used here as synonym for na’arahbetulah, Genesis 24:16; see Isaiah 7:14, p.vii-xii] cometh forth to draw mayim, and I say to her, Give me, now, a little mayim of thy jar to drink;

44.verse: And she say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy gemalim; let the same be the isha whom Hashem hath appointed for ben adoni.

45.verse: And before I had done davening in mine lev, hinei, Rivkah came forth with her jar on her shoulder; and she went down unto ha’ayenah, and drew: and I said unto her, Let me drink, now.

46.verse: And she made haste, and let down her jar from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy gemalim drink also: so I drank, and she made the gemalim drink also.

47.verse: And I asked her, and said, Whose bat art thou? And she said, Bat Beituel Ben Nachor, the ben whom Milcah bore unto him: and I put the nezem upon her face, and the tzemidim upon her wrists.

48.verse: And I bowed down my head, and worshiped Hashem, and I said a brocha to Hashem Elohei adoni Avraham, which had led me on the derech emes to take bat achi adoni for bno.

49.verse: And now if ye will do chesed and emes to adoni, tell me; and if not, tell me; that I may turn to yamin, or to smol.

50.verse: Then Lavan and Beituel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from Hashem; we cannot speak unto thee rah or tov.

51.verse: Hinei, Rivkah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be isha for ben adonecha, just as Hashem hath spoken.

52.verse: And it came to pass, that, when eved Avraham heard their words, he worshiped Hashem, bowing himself to the ground.

53.verse: And the eved brought forth kelei kesef, and kelei zahav, and begadim, and gave them to Rivkah; he gave also to her ach and to her em migdanot (costly gifts).

54.verse: And they did eat and drink, he and the anashim that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the boker, and he said, Send me away unto adoni.

55.verse: And her ach and her em said, Let the na’arah abide with us ten days or so; after that she shall go.

56.verse: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing Hashem hath prospered my derech; send me away that I may go to adoni.

57.verse: And they said, We will call the na’arah, and inquire at her mouth.

58.verse: And they called Rivkah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this ish? And she said, I will go.

59.verse: And they sent away Rivkah their achot, and her nurse, and eved Avraham, and his anashim.

60.verse: And they said a brocha over Rivkah, and said unto her, Thou art achoteinu, may thou be increased to thousands upon thousands and may thy zera possess the sha’ar of those which hate them.

61.verse: And Rivkah arose, and her na’arot, and they rode upon the gemalim, and followed the ish: and the eved took Rivkah, and went his way.

62.verse: And Yitzchak had come from Be’er Lachi Roi; for he dwelt in the eretz hanegev.

63.verse: And Yitzchak went out to meditate in the sadeh at erev: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, hinei, the gemalim (camels) were coming.

64.verse: And Rivkah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Yitzchak, she got down from the gamal.

65.verse: For she had said unto the eved, Who is that ish that walketh in the sadeh to meet us? And the eved had said, He is adoni: therefore she took a veil, and covered herself.

66.verse: And the eved told Yitzchak all things that he had done.

67.verse: And Yitzchak brought her into the ohel of Sarah immo, and took Rivkah, and she became his isha; and he loved her: and Yitzchak was comforted after the [mot] immo.

1.verse: Then again Avraham took an isha, and her shem was Keturah.

2.verse: And she bore him Zimran, and Yokshan, and Medan, and Midyan, and Yishbak, and Shuach.

3.verse: And Yokshan fathered Sheva, and Dedan. And the bnei Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.

4.verse: And the bnei Midyan; Ephah, and Epher, and Chanoch, and Avida, and Eldaah. All these were the bnei Keturah.

5.verse: And Avraham gave all that he had unto Yitzchak.

6.verse: But unto the bnei hapilageshim (sons of the concubines), which Avraham had, Avraham gave mattanot, and sent them away from Yitzchak bno, while he yet lived, eastward, unto eretz kedem.

7.verse: And these are the days of the years of Avraham’s life which he lived, a hundred threescore and fifteen shanim.

8.verse: Then Avraham breathed his last, and died in a good old age, a zaken, full of years; and was gathered to his people.

9.verse: And his banim Yitzchak and Yishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the sadeh of Ephron ben Tzochar the Chitti, which is near Mamre;

10.verse: The sadeh which Avraham purchased of the bnei Chet, there was Avraham buried, and Sarah his wife.

11.verse: And it came to pass after the mot Avraham, that Elohim blessed Yitzchak bno; and Yitzchak dwelt near Be’er Lachai Roi.

12.verse: Now these are the toldot Yishmael ben Avraham, whom Hagar the Egyptian, shifchat Sarah, bore unto Avraham:

13.verse: And these are the shemot bnei Yishmael, by their shemot, according to their toldot: the bechor of Yishmael, Nevayot; and Kedar, and Adbe’el, and Mivsam,

14.verse: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,

15.verse: Chadad, and Tema, Yetur, Naphish, and Kedmah:

16.verse: These are the bnei Yishmael, and these are their shemot, by their settlement, and by their camps; twelve nasiim (princes, rulers) according to their tribes.

17.verse: And these are the years of the life of Yishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven shanah; and he breathed his last and died; and was gathered unto his people.

18.verse: And they dwelt from Chavilah unto Shur, that is near Mitzrayim, as thou goest toward Assyria; they took their place east of their brethren.

19.verse: [TOLDOS] - And these are the toldot of Yitzchak ben Avraham: Avraham fathered Yitzchak;

20.verse: And Yitzchak was arba’im shanah when he took Rivkah as his wife, the bat Betuel the Aramean of Padan Aram, the achot Lavan the Aramean.

21.verse: And Yitzchak davened to Hashem on behalf of his isha, because she was barren; and Hashem was entreated of him, and Rivkah his isha conceived.

22.verse: And the banim struggled jostling within her; and she said, If it be well, why am I thus? And she went to inquire of Hashem.

23.verse: And Hashem said unto her, Two goyim (nations) are in thy womb, and two peoples shall be separated from within thee; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the older shall serve the younger.

24.verse: And when her days were fulfilled to be delivered, hinei, there were twins in her womb.

25.verse: And the first came out admoni (red) all over like a hairy garment; and they called shmo Esav.

26.verse: And after that came out his brother, and his yad was grasping on akev Esav; and shmo was called Ya’akov; and Yitzchak was threescore shanah when she bore them.

27.verse: And the nearim grew: and Esav was a skilled hunter, an ish sadeh; and Ya’akov was an ish tam (quiet man), dwelling in ohalim.

28.verse: And Yitzchak loved Esav, because he did eat of his wild game; but Rivkah loved Ya’akov.

29.verse: And Ya’akov cooked stew: and Esav came from the sadeh, and he was famished.

30.verse: And Esav said to Ya’akov, Let me eat now some of the adom (red stew); for I am famished; therefore was shmo called Edom.

31.verse: And Ya’akov said, First sell me today thy bechorah (birthright, right of the firstborn).

32.verse: And Esav said, Hinei, I am at the point of death; and what profit shall this bechorah do to me?

33.verse: And Ya’akov said, Swear to me this day; and he swore unto him; and he sold his bechorah unto Ya’akov.

34.verse: Then Ya’akov gave Esav lechem and adashim (lentils) stew; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way; thus Esav despised his bechorah.

1.verse: And there was a ra’av (famine) in ha’aretz, besides the ra’av harishon that was in the days of Avraham. And Yitzchak went unto Avimelech Melech Pelishtim (Philistines) unto Gerar.

2.verse: And Hashem appeared unto him, and said, Go not down into Mitzrayim; dwell in ha’aretz which I shall tell thee of;

3.verse: Sojourn in ha’aretz hazot, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy zera, I will give all these lands, and I will perform the shevu’ah (oath) which I swore unto Avraham avichah;

4.verse: And I will make thy zera to multiply as the kokhavim of Shomayim, and will give unto thy zera all these lands; and in thy zera shall kol Goyei Ha’Aretz be blessed;

5.verse: Because Avraham obeyed My voice, and was shomer over My mishmeret (charge), My mitzvot, My chukkot, and My torot.

6.verse: And Yitzchak dwelt in Gerar;

7.verse: And the anshei hamakom asked him about his isha; and he said, She is my achot; for he feared to say, She is my isha; lest, said he, the anshei hamakom should kill me for Rivkah; because she was beautiful to look upon.

8.verse: And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Avimelech Melech Pelishtim (Philistines) looked out at a chalon, and saw, and, hinei, Yitzchak metzachek (was caressing) Rivkah his isha.

9.verse: And Avimelech called Yitzchak, and said, Hinei, of a surety she is thy isha; and why saidst thou, She is my achot? And Yitzchak said unto him, Because I said, Lest I die because of her.

10.verse: And Avimelech said, What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might lightly have slept with thy isha, and thou shouldest have brought asham (guilt) upon us.

11.verse: And Avimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his isha shall surely be put to death.

12.verse: Then Yitzchak sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year a hundredfold; and Hashem blessed him.

13.verse: And the man became very prosperous, and went forward, and grew until he became gadol me’od:

14.verse: For he had possession of tzon, and possession of herds, and many avadim; and the Pelishtim envied him.

15.verse: For all the wells which avdei aviv had dug in the days of Avraham aviv, the Pelishtim had stopped them up, and filled them with dirt.

16.verse: And Avimelech said unto Yitzchak, Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.

17.verse: And Yitzchak departed from there, and encamped in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.

18.verse: And Yitzchak dug again the be’erot hamayim (wells of water), which they had dug in the days of Avraham aviv; for the Pelishtim had stopped them up after the mot Avraham; and he called their shemot after the shemot by which his av had called them.

19.verse: And avdei Yitzchak dug in the valley, and found there a well of mayim chayyim.

20.verse: And the herdmen of Gerar did quarrel with Yitzchak’s herdmen, saying, The mayim is ours; and he called the shem of the well Esek (Contention); because they disputed with him.

21.verse: And they dug another be’er, and feuded over that also; and he called the shem of it Sitnah (Enmity).

22.verse: And he moved away from there, and dug another well; and for that they strove not: and he called the shem of it Rechovot (Broad Places); and he said, For now Hashem hath made rachav (room) for us, and we shall be fruitful in ha’aretz.

23.verse: And he went up from there to Beer-Sheva.

24.verse: And Hashem appeared unto him balailah hahu, and said, I am Elohei Avraham avichah; fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy zera for the sake of Avdi Avraham (My Servant Abraham).

25.verse: And he built a Mizbe’ach there, and called upon the Shem of Hashem, and pitched his ohel there: and there avdei Yitzchak dug a well.

26.verse: Then Avimelech went to him from Gerar, and Achuzzat his adviser, and Phichol the sar tz’va of his.

27.verse: And Yitzchak said unto them, Why come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?

28.verse: And they said, We saw certainly that Hashem was with thee; and we said, Let there be now an oath between us, even between us and thee, and let us cut a brit (covenant) with thee;

29.verse: That thou wilt do us no ra’ah, just as we have not touched thee, and just as we have done unto thee nothing but tov, and have sent thee away in shalom; thou art now the Beruch Hashem (the blessed of Hashem).

30.verse: And he made them a mishteh (feast), and they did eat and drink.

31.verse: And they rose up early in the boker, and swore one to another: and Yitzchak sent them away, and they departed from him in shalom.

32.verse: And it came to pass the same day, that the avdei Yitzchak came, and told him concerning the be’er which they had dug, and said unto him, We have found mayim.

33.verse: And he called it Shevah (Seven, Oath): therefore the shem of the Ir is Beer-Sheva unto this day.

34.verse: And Esav was arba’im shanah when he took to wife Yehudit the bat Beeri the Chitti, and Basemat the bat Elon the Chitti:

35.verse: and they were a morat ruach (grief of mind) unto Yitzchak and Rivkah.

1.verse: And it came to pass, that when Yitzchak was zaken (old),and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esav bno hagadol and said unto him, Beni: and he said unto him, Hineni.

2.verse: And he said, Hinei now, I am old, I know not my yom mot:

3.verse: Therefore take, now, thy kelim (weapons), thy quiver and thy keshet (bow), and go out to the sadeh, and hunt me some wild game;

4.verse: And make me matamim (savory meat, tasty food), such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my nefesh may make a brocha upon thee before I die.

5.verse: And Rivkah heard when Yitzchak spoke to Esav bno. And Esav went to the sadeh to hunt for wild game, and to bring it

6.verse: And Rivkah spoke unto Ya’akov her ben, saying, Hinei, I heard avicha speak unto Esav achicha, saying,

7.verse: Bring me wild game, and make me matamim, that I may eat, and make a brocha upon thee before Hashem before my mot.

8.verse: Now therefore, beni (my son), obey my kol (voice) according to that which I command thee.

9.verse: Go now to the tzon, and bring me from there two gedayei izzim tovim (good kids of goats); and I will make them matamim for avicha, such as he loveth:

10.verse: And thou shalt bring it to avicha, that he may eat, and that he may make a brocha upon thee before his mot.

11.verse: And Ya’akov said to Rivkah immo, Look, Esav achi is an ish sa’ir (hairy man), and I am an ish chalak (smooth man)

12.verse: What if avi will touch me, and I shall seem to him as a meta’te’a (mocker); and I shall bring a kelalah upon me, and not a brocha.

13.verse: And immo said unto him, Upon me be thy kelalah, beni; only obey my kol (voice), and go bring me them.

14.verse: And he went, and got, and brought them to immo: and immo made matamim, such as aviv loved.

15.verse: And Rivkah took begadim of Esav her ben hagadol, the chamudot (best ones) which were with her in the bais, and dressed Ya’akov her ben hakatan;

16.verse: And with orot gedayei haizzim (skins of the kids of the goats) she dressed and covered his hands, and also upon the smooth of his tzavar (neck);

17.verse: And she gave the matamim and the lechem, which she had prepared, into the yad Ya’akov her ben.

18.verse: And he came unto aviv, and said, Avi; and he said, Hineni; who art thou, beni?

19.verse: And Ya’akov said unto aviv, I am Esav thy bechor; I have done according as thou told me; arise, now, sit up and eat of my wild game, that thy nefesh may make a brocha upon me.

20.verse: And Yitzchak said unto bno, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, beni? And he said, Hashem Eloheicha worked it out for me.

21.verse: And Yitzchak said unto Ya’akov, Come near, now, that I may touch thee, beni, indeed, whether thou be beni Esav or not.

22.verse: And Ya’akov went near unto Yitzchak aviv; and he touched him, and said, The kol is kol Ya’akov, but the yadayim are the yedei Esav.

23.verse: And he discerned him not, for his hands were se’irot, as yedei Esav achiv; so he made a brocha upon him

24.verse: And he said, Art thou indeed beni Esav? And he said, I am.

25.verse: And he said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of the wild game of beni, that my nefesh may make a brocha upon thee. And he brought it near to him, and he did eat; and he brought him yayin and he drank.

26.verse: And aviv Yitzchak said unto him, Come near now, and kiss me beni.

27.verse: And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the reiach (smell) of his begadim, and made a brocha upon him, and said, See, the reiach of beni is as the reiach of a sadeh upon which Hashem hath made a brocha;

28.verse: Therefore HaElohim give thee of the tal haShomayim, and the fatness of ha’aretz, and plenty of dagan and tirosh;

29.verse: Let people serve thee, and amim bow down to thee: be gevir over thy achim, and let bnei immecha bow down to thee: arur be every one that curseth thee, and baruch be he that blesseh thee.

30.verse: And as soon as Yitzchak had completed making on Ya’akov a brocha, and Ya’akov had hardly gone out from the presence of Yitzchak aviv, that Esav achiv came in from his hunt.

31.verse: And he also had prepared matamim, and brought it unto aviv and said unto aviv, Let avi arise, and eat of the wild game of bno, that thy nefesh may make a brocha upon me.

32.verse: And Yitzchak aviv said unto him, Mi atah? (Who art thou?) And he said, I am binecha, thy bechor Esav.

33.verse: And Yitzchak trembled with charadah gedolah ad me’od (exceedingly great trembling), and said, Who? Where is he that hath hunted wild game, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all of it before thou camest, and have made a brocha upon him? And indeed he shall be baruch (blessed)!

34.verse: And when Esav heard the words of aviv, he cried with tzeakah gedolah umarah ad me’od (a great and exceeding bitter cry), and said unto aviv, Make a brocha on me, even me also, O avi.

35.verse: And he said, Achicha came with mirmah (deceit), and hath taken away thy brocha.

36.verse: And he said, Is not he rightly called shmo Ya’akov? for vaya’keveni (now he deceived/outwitted me) these two times he took away my bechorah (birthright); and, hinei, now he hath taken away my brocha (blessing). And he asked, Hast thou not reserved a brocha for me?

37.verse: And Yitzchak answered and said unto Esav, See, I have made him gevir over you, and all his achim have I given to him for avadim; and with dagan and tirosh have I sustained him; and what shall I do now unto thee, beni?

38.verse: And Esav said unto aviv, Hast thou but one brocha, avi? Make a brocha on me, even me also, O avi. And Esav lifted up his kol (voice), and wept.

39.verse: And Yitzchak aviv answered and said unto him, Hinei, thy moshav (dwelling) shall be the fatness of ha’aretz, and of the tal HaShomayim from above;

40.verse: And by thy cherev shalt thou live, and shalt serve achicha; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt become restless, that thou shalt break his ol (yoke) from off thy tzavar (neck).

41.verse: And Esav hated Ya’akov because of the brocha wherewith aviv made a brocha upon him: and Esav said in his lev, The yemei evel (days of mourning) for avi are at hand; then will I slay Ya’akov achi.

42.verse: And these words of Esav her ben hagadol were told to Rivkah; and she sent and called Ya’akov her ben hakatan, and said unto him, Hinei, Esav achicha, as touching thee, doth console himself, purposing to kill thee.

43.verse: Now therefore, beni, shema bekoli (listen to my voice)! Arise, flee thou to Lavan achi to Charan;

44.verse: And tarry with him a few days, until chamat achicha subsides;

45.verse: And when af achicha subsides from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him; then I will send, and get thee from there. Why should I be bereaved also of you both in yom echad (one day, the same day)?

46.verse: And Rivkah said to Yitzchak, I am weary of my life because of the Banot Chet: if Ya’akov take an isha of the Banot Chet (Hittite women) such as these which are of the banot ha’aretz, what will chayyim to me be?

1.verse: And Yitzchak called for Ya’akov, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take an isha of the Banot Kena’an.

2.verse: Arise, go to Paddanah- Aram, to the bais Betuel avi immecha; and take thee an isha from there of the banot Lavan achi immecha.

3.verse: And El Shaddai bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a kahal amim;

4.verse: And give thee the birkat Avraham, to thee, and to thy zera with thee; that thou mayest inherit the eretz wherein thou art a ger, which Elohim gave unto Avraham.

5.verse: And Yitzchak sent away Ya’akov; and he went to Padanah-Aram unto Lavan ben Betuel the Aramean, achi Rivkah, em Ya’akov and Esav.

6.verse: When Esav saw that Yitzchak had blessed Ya’akov, and sent him away to Padanah-Aram, to take an isha for him from there; and that when he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take an isha of the Banot Kena’an;

7.verse: And that Ya’akov obeyed his av and his em, and went to Padanah-Aram;

8.verse: And Esav seeing that the Banot Kena’an pleased not Yitzchak his av;

9.verse: Then went Esav unto Yishmael, and took unto the nashim which he had Machalat bat Yishmael ben Avraham, the achot of Nevayot, to be his wife.

10.verse: [VAYETZE] - And Ya’akov went out from Beer-Sheva, and went toward Charan.

11.verse: And he reached a certain place, and tarried there, because the shemesh was set; and he took of the avanim of that place, and put them for his pillow, and lay down in that place to sleep.

12.verse: And he had a chalom, and hinei a sullam (ladder, stairway) set up on the ground, and the top of it reached to Shomayim: and hinei the malachim of Elohim ascending and descending on it.

13.verse: And, hinei, Hashem stood above it, and said, I am Hashem Elohei Avraham thy av, and Elohei Yitzchak; ha’aretz whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy zera;

14.verse: And thy zera shall be as the dust of ha’aretz, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south; and in thee and in thy zera shall kol hamishpochot haadamah be blessed.

15.verse: And, hinei, I am with thee, and will be shomer over thee in all places where thou goest, and will bring thee back into haadamah hazot; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have promised thee.

16.verse: And Ya’akov awoke out of his sleep, and he said, Surely Hashem is in this place! And I had no da’as of it.

17.verse: And he was afraid, and said, How nora (awesome) is this place! This is none other than the Beis Elohim, and this is the Sha’ar HaShomayim.

18.verse: And Ya’akov rose up early in the boker, and took haeven (the stone) that he had put for his pillow, and set it up for a matzevah (pillar), and poured shemen upon the top of it.

19.verse: And he called the shem of that place Beit-El; but the shem of that ir was called Luz at the first.

20.verse: And Ya’akov vowed a neder (vow), saying, If Elohim will be with me, and will be shomer over me in this derech (way, journey) that I go, and will give me lechem to eat, and beged (clothes) to put on,

21.verse: So that I return to bais avi in shalom; then shall Hashem be for me Elohim (my G-d).

22.verse: And this even (stone), which I have set for a matzevah (pillar), shall be Beis Elohim: and of all that Thou shalt give me I will surely give the aser (tenth) unto Thee.

1.verse: Then Ya’akov went on his journey, and came into the eretz of the bnei kedem.

2.verse: And he looked, and hinei a be’er in the sadeh, and, hinei, there were shloshah edrei tzon lying by it; for out of that be’er they watered the edarim: and a great even (stone) was upon the mouth of the be’er.

3.verse: And to there were all the edarim gathered: and they rolled the even (stone) from the mouth of the be’er, and watered the tzon, and put the even (stone) again upon the mouth of the be’er in its place.

4.verse: And Ya’akov said unto them, My brethren, where are you from? And they said, Of Charan are we.

5.verse: And he said unto them, Know ye Lavan ben Nachor? And they said, We know him.

6.verse: And he said unto them, Is the shalom with him? And they said, Shalom; and, hinei, Rachel his bat cometh with the tzon.

7.verse: And he said, Look, the sun is still high, neither is it time that the flock should be gathered together; water ye the tzon, and go and feed them.

8.verse: And they said, We cannot, until all the edarim be gathered together, and till they roll the even (stone) from the mouth of the be’er; then we water the tzon.

9.verse: And while he yet spoke with them, Rachel came with the tzon of her av; for she was a ro’ah (shepherdess).

10.verse: And it came to pass, when Ya’akov saw Rachel bat Lavan achi immo, and the tzon of Lavan achi immo, that Ya’akov went near, and rolled the even (stone) from the mouth of the be’er, and watered the tzon of Lavan achi immo.

11.verse: And Ya’akov kissed Rachel, and lifted up his voice, and wept.

12.verse: And Ya’akov told Rachel that he was the relative of her av, and that he was ben Rivkah; and she ran and told her av.

13.verse: And it came to pass, when Lavan heard the news of Ya’akov ben achoto, that he ran to meet him, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his bais. And he told Lavan all these things.

14.verse: And Lavan said to him, Surely thou art my etzem (bone) and my basar. And he abode with him the space of a chodesh (month).

15.verse: And Lavan said unto Ya’akov, Because thou art my relative, shouldest thou therefore serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall thy maskoret (wages) be?

16.verse: And Lavan had two banot: the shem of the elder was Leah, and the shem of the younger was Rachel.

17.verse: Leah had weak eyes; but Rachel was yafeh and lovely in form.

18.verse: And Ya’akov loved Rachel; and said, I will serve thee sheva shanim for Rachel thy bat haketannah (younger daughter).

19.verse: And Lavan said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that I should give her to another ish; abide with me.

20.verse: And Ya’akov served sheva shanim for Rachel; and they seemed unto him but a few yamim, because of the ahavah he had for her.

21.verse: And Ya’akov said unto Lavan, Give me my isha, for my yamim are completed, that I may go in unto her.

22.verse: And Lavan gathered together all the anshei hamakom, and made a mishteh (feast).

23.verse: And it came to pass in the erev, that he took Leah his bat, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.

24.verse: And Lavan gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah shifchato (his maid) for a shifchah.

25.verse: And it came to pass, that in the boker, hinei, it was Leah! And he said to Lavan, What is this thou hast done unto me? Did not I serve with thee for Rachel? So why then hast thou deceived me?

26.verse: And Lavan said, It must not be so done in our land, to give the younger before the bechirah.

27.verse: Finish her shvu’a (week), and we will give thee this also for the avodah (service, work) which thou shalt do for me yet sheva shanim acherot.

28.verse: And Ya’akov did so, and fulfilled her shvu’a; and he gave him Rachel his bat to be his isha also.

29.verse: And Lavan gave to his bat Rachel Bilhah his shifchah to be her shifchah.

30.verse: And he went in also unto Rachel, and he loved also Rachel more than Leah, and served him yet sheva shanim acherot.

31.verse: And when Hashem saw that Leah was hated, He opened her womb but Rachel was barren.

32.verse: And Leah conceived, and bore a ben, and she called shmo Reuven: for she said, Surely Hashem hath looked upon my misery; now therefore my ish will love me.

33.verse: And she conceived again, and bore ben; and said, Because Hashem hath heard I was hated, He hath therefore given me this also; and she called shmo Shimon.

34.verse: And she conceived again, and bore ben; and said, Now this time will my ish yillaveh (become attached) unto me, because I have born him shloshah banim: therefore was shmo called Levi.

35.verse: And she conceived again, and bore ben; and she said, Now will odeh (I praise) Hashem; therefore she called shmo Yehudah; and stopped giving birth.

1.verse: And when Rachel saw that she did not bear [banim] to Ya’akov, Rachel had kina toward her achot; and said unto Ya’akov, Give me banim, or else I die.

2.verse: And af Ya’akov was kindled against Rachel; and he said, Am I in place of Elohim, Who hath withheld from thee p’ri beten?

3.verse: And she said, Hinei my amah (maidservant) Bilhah, go in unto her; and she shall bear upon my birkayim, that I may also build up through her.

4.verse: And she gave him Bilhah her shifchah (slave woman, maidservant) as isha; and Ya’akov went in unto her.

5.verse: And Bilhah conceived, and bore Ya’akov ben.

6.verse: And Rachel said, Elohim danani (G-d hath judged me), and hath also heard my voice, and hath given to me ben: therefore called she shmo Dan.

7.verse: And Bilhah shifchat Rachel conceived again, and bore Ya’akov ben sheni.

8.verse: And Rachel said, With naftulei Elohim niflalti (with wrestlings of G-d have I wrestled) with my achot, and I have prevailed: and she called shmo Naphtali.

9.verse: When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing, she took Zilpah her shifchah, and gave her to Ya’akov as isha.

10.verse: And Zilpah shifchat Leah bore Ya’akov ben.

11.verse: And Leah said, BaGad (What Good Fortune!) And she called shmo Gad.

12.verse: And Zilpah shifchat Leah bore Ya’akov ben sheni.

13.verse: And Leah said, B’Ashri (Happy am I), for the banot will call me asher (blessed): so she called shmo Asher.

14.verse: And Reuven went in the yemei ketzir chittim, and found duda’im (mandrakes) in the sadeh, and brought them unto Leah immo. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, now, of the duda’im of thy ben.

15.verse: And she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken my ish? And wouldest thou take away the duda’im of beni also? And Rachel said, Therefore he shall lie with thee halailah (tonight) for the duda’im of thy ben.

16.verse: And Ya’akov came in from the sadeh ba’erev, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, Thou must come in unto me; for surely I have hired thee with duda’im of beni. And he lay with her that night.

17.verse: And Elohim paid heed unto Leah, and she conceived, and bore Ya’akov ben chamishi.

18.verse: And Leah said, Elohim hath given me my hire, because I have given my shifchah to my ish; and she called shmo Yissakhar.

19.verse: And Leah conceived again, and bore Ya’akov ben shishi.

20.verse: And Leah said, Elohim hath endued me with a zeved tov (good endowment); now will my ish zabal (honor) me, because I have born him shisha banim; and she called shmo Zevulun.

21.verse: And afterwards she bore a bat, and called her shem Dinah.

22.verse: And Elohim remembered Rachel, and Elohim paid heed to her, and opened her rekhem (womb).

23.verse: And she conceived, and bore ben; and said, Elohim hath taken away my cherpah (shame, disgrace, reproach);

24.verse: And she called shmo Yosef; and said, yosef (may He add), may Hashem add me ben acher (another son).

25.verse: And it came to pass, when Rachel had born Yosef, that Ya’akov said unto Lavan, Send me away, that I may go unto mine own makom (place, home) and to my eretz.

26.verse: Give me my nashim and my yeladim, for whom I have served thee, and let me go: for thou knowest my avodah which I have done thee.

27.verse: And Lavan said unto him, Now, if I have found chen (favor, grace) in thine eyes, tarry; for I have learned by nachash (divination) that Hashem hath made a brocha upon me for thy sake.

28.verse: And he said, Specify thy sachar (wages, reward), and I will pay it.

29.verse: And he said unto him, Thou knowest how I have served thee, and how thy mikneh fared with me

30.verse: For it was me’at (little) which thou hadst before I came, and it is now increased unto a multitude; and Hashem hath made a brocha upon thee since my coming; and now when shall I do for mine own bais also?

31.verse: And he said, What shall I give thee? And Ya’akov said, Thou shalt not give me any thing; if thou wilt do this thing for me, I will again tend and be shomer over thy tzon.

32.verse: I will pass through all thy tzon today, removing from there speckled and spotted seh, and every dark seh among the kesavim, and the spotted and speckled among the izzim; and of such shall be my sachar.

33.verse: So shall my tzedakah answer for me in time to come, when it shall come for my sachar before thy face; every one that is not speckled and spotted among the izzim, and dark among the kesavim, that shall be counted a ganav’s with me.

34.verse: And Lavan said, Agreed, I would it might be according to thy davar.

35.verse: And he removed that day the male goats that were streaked and spotted, and all the izzim that were speckled and spotted, and every one that had some lavan in it, and all the dark among the kesavim, and gave them into the yad of his banim.

36.verse: And he set a derech shloshet yamim between himself and Ya’akov; and Ya’akov tended the rest of the tzon Lavan.

37.verse: And Ya’akov took him fresh cut makal (rod, branch) of poplar and of almond and plane tree; and peeled strips of bark in them, and made the lavan (white) appear which was in the maklot (rods, branches).

38.verse: And he set the maklot which he had peeled before the flocks in the small channels of the shikatot mayim (watering troughs) when the tzon came to drink. And since they bred when they came to drink,

39.verse: And the flocks bred before the maklot, and brought forth tzon streaked, speckled, and spotted.

40.verse: And Ya’akov did separate the kesavim, and set the faces of the tzon toward the streaked, and all the dark in the tzon Lavan; and he put his own adarim (flocks) by themselves, and put them not unto the tzon Lavan.

41.verse: And it came to pass, whensoever tzon hamekusharot (the stronger flock) did breed, that Ya’akov set the maklot before the eyes of the tzon in the trough channels, that they might breed among the maklot.

42.verse: But when the tzon were feeble, he put them not in: so the feebler would belong to Lavan, and the stronger to Ya’akov.

43.verse: And the ish increased exceedingly, and had much tzon, and shefachot, and avadim, and gemalim, and chamorim.

1.verse: And he heard the divrei Bnei Lavan, saying, Ya’akov hath taken away all that belonged to avinu; and of that which belonged to avinu hath he gotten all this kavod.

2.verse: And Ya’akov beheld the countenance of Lavan, and, hinei, it was not toward him as before.

3.verse: And Hashem said unto Ya’akov, Shuv el Eretz Avoteicha! And to thy moledet; and I will be with thee.

4.verse: And Ya’akov sent and called Rachel and Leah to the sadeh unto his tzon,

5.verse: And said unto them, I see penei avichen, that it is not toward me as before; but Elohei Avi is with me.

6.verse: And ye know that with all my koach I have served avichen.

7.verse: And avichen hath deceived me, and changed my sachar aseret monim but Elohim allowed him not to harm me.

8.verse: If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy sachar; then all the tzon bore speckled; and if he said thus, The streaked shall be thy sachar; then bore all the tzon streaked.

9.verse: Thus Elohim hath taken away the mikneh of your av, and given them to me.

10.verse: And it came to pass at the time that the tzon breed, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a chalom, and, hinei, the male goats mounting the tzon were streaked, speckled, and spotted.

11.verse: And the Malach HaElohim spoke unto me in a chalom saying, Ya’akov: And I said, Hineni.

12.verse: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the male goats leaping upon the tzon are streaked, speckled, and spotted; for I have seen all that Lavan doeth unto thee.

13.verse: I am HaEl Beit-El, where thou anointedst a matzevah (pillar), and where thou vowedst a neder (vow) unto Me: now arise, get thee out from HaAretz Hazot, and return unto thy eretz moledet.

14.verse: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any chelek or nachalah for us in bais avinu?

15.verse: Are we not regarded by him nokhriyyot (foreigners, strangers)? For he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our kesef.

16.verse: For all the oisher Elohim hath taken from avinu, that belongs to us and baneinu; so then, whatsoever Elohim hath said unto thee, do.

17.verse: Then Ya’akov rose up, and set his banim and his nashim upon the gemalim;

18.verse: And he drove all his mikneh, and all his goods which he had gotten, the mikneh of his getting, which he had gotten in Padan Aram, for to go to Yitzchak aviv in Eretz Kena’an.

19.verse: And Lavan went to shear his tzon; and Rachel had stolen the terafim that belong to her av.

20.verse: Unawares to Lavan HaArami, Ya’akov stole away, in that he told him not that he was fleeing.

21.verse: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the Nahar [i.e. the Euphrates], and set his face toward Har Gil’ad.

22.verse: And it was told Lavan on Yom HaShlishi that Ya’akov was fled.

23.verse: And he took his achim with him, and pursued after him derech shivat yamim; and they overtook him at Har Gil‘ad.

24.verse: And Elohim came to Lavan HaArami in a chalom halailah, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Ya’akov either tov or rah.

25.verse: Then Lavan overtook Ya’akov. Now Ya’akov had pitched his ohel on the har; and Lavan with his achim encamped in Har Gil‘ad.

26.verse: And Lavan said to Ya’akov, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my banot, like shevuyot (captives) taken with the cherev?

27.verse: Why didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with simchah, and with shirim (songs), with tof (timbrel, tambourine) and with kinnor (harp)?

28.verse: And hast not allowed me to kiss my banim (grandchildren) and my banot? Thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.

29.verse: It is in the power of my yad to do you rah; but Elohei Avichem spoke unto me emesh (last night), saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Ya’akov either tov or rah.

30.verse: And now, though thou had to go, because thou greatly longedst after bais avicha, yet why hast thou stolen elohai?

31.verse: And Ya’akov answered and said to Lavan, Because I was afraid; for I said, Thou wouldest take by force thy banot from me.

32.verse: With whomsoever thou findest eloheicha, let him not live; before acheinu discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Ya’akov knew not that Rachel had played the ganav with them.

33.verse: And Lavan went into the ohel Ya’akov, and into the ohel Leah and into the ohel shtei ha’amahot; but he found them not. Then went he out of the ohel Leah, and entered into the ohel Rachel.

34.verse: Now Rachel had taken the terafim, and put them in the saddle of the gamal, and sat upon them. And Lavan searched all the ohel, but found them not.

35.verse: And she said to her av, Let it not displease adoni that I cannot rise up in thy presence; for the derech nashim is upon me. And he searched but found not the terafim.

36.verse: And Ya’akov was in wrath, and upbraided Lavan: and Ya’akov answered and said to Lavan, What is my peysha? What is my chattat, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?

37.verse: Whereas thou hast searched through all that I own, what hast thou found of all thy kelei bais? Set it here before my achim and thy achim, that they may judge between us both.

38.verse: These esrim shanah have I been with thee; recheleicha (thy ewes) and thy female goats have not miscarried, and the rams of thy tzon have I not eaten.

39.verse: That which was terefah (torn of beasts) I brought not unto thee; I bore the loss of it; of my yad didst thou require it, whether stolen by yom, or stolen by lailah.

40.verse: Thus I was; in the yom the chorev (heat) consumed me, and the kerach (cold) by lailah; and my sheynah (sleep) departed from mine eyes.

41.verse: Thus have I been esrim shanah in thy bais; I served thee arba-esreh shanah for thy two banot, and shesh shanim for thy tzon: and thou hast changed my sachar aseret monim.

42.verse: Except Elohei Avi, Elohei Avraham, and the Pachad of Yitzchak had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty handed. Elohim hath seen mine oni and the toil of my palms, and rebuked thee emesh (last night).

43.verse: And Lavan answered and said unto Ya’akov, These banot are my banot, and these banim are my banim, and this tzon is my tzon, and all that thou seest is mine; yet what can I do today about these my banot, or about their banim which they have born?

44.verse: Now therefore come thou, let us cut a brit, I and thou; and let it be for an ed between me and thee.

45.verse: And Ya’akov took an even, and set it up for a matzevah (pillar).

46.verse: And Ya’akov said unto his achim, Gather avanim; and they took avanim, and made a gal (heap, mound); and they did eat there upon the gal.

47.verse: And Lavan called it Yegar Sahaduta; but Ya’akov called it Gale’ed ("Heap of Witness").

48.verse: And Lavan said, This gal (heap, mound) is an ed (witness) between me and thee this day. Therefore was shmo called Gale’ed;

49.verse: And Mitzpah (Watch); for he said, Hashem watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.

50.verse: If thou shalt afflict my banot, or if thou shalt take nashim besides my banot, no man is with us; see, Elohim ed beini uveinecha (Elohim is witness between me and you).

51.verse: And Lavan said to Ya’akov, Hinei this gal (heap, mound), and hinei the matzevah (pillar), which I have cast between me and thee;

52.verse: This gal (heap, mound) be ed (witness), and this matzevah (pillar) be edah (witness), that for ra’ah I will not pass over this gal to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this gal and this matzevah unto me.

53.verse: The Elohei Avraham, and Elohei Nachor, Elohei Avihem judge between us. And Ya’akov swore by the Pachad Aviv Yitzchak.

54.verse: Then Ya’akov offered zavach upon the har, and called his achim to eat lechem; and they did eat lechem, and tarried all night on the har.

55.verse: And early in the boker (morning) Lavan rose up, and kissed his banim and his banot, and made on them a brocha; and Lavan departed, and returned unto his makom.

1.verse: And Ya’akov went on his derech, and the malachim of Elohim met him.

2.verse: And when Ya’akov saw them, he said, This is Mahaneh Elohim; and he called the shem of that makom (place) Machanayim.

3.verse: [VAYISHLAH] - And Ya’akov sent malachim before him to Esav achiv unto Eretz Seir, the country of Edom.

4.verse: And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak unto adoni Esav; Thy eved Ya’akov saith thus, I have sojourned with Lavan, and stayed there until now;

5.verse: And I have shor (oxen), and chamor, tzon, and eved, and shifchah; and I have sent to tell adoni, that I may find chen (grace) in thy sight.

6.verse: And the malachim returned to Ya’akov, saying, We came to Esav achicha, and also he cometh to meet thee, and arba me’ot ish with him.

7.verse: Then Ya’akov was greatly afraid and distressed; and he divided HaAm that was with him, and the tzon, and bakar, and the gemalim, into two machanot;

8.verse: And said, If Esav come to the one machaneh, and attack it, then the other machaneh which is left shall escape.

9.verse: And Ya’akov said, O Elohei Avi Avraham, and Elohei Avi Yitzchak, Hashem which saidst unto me, Shuv l’aretzecha and to thy moledet (kindred), and I will deal well with thee;

10.verse: I am not worthy of the least of all the chasadim, and of all the emes, which Thou hast showed unto Thy eved; for with my makal (rod, staff) I passed over this Yarden; and now I am become two machanot.

11.verse: Save me, now, from the yad achi, from the yad Esav; for I fear him, lest he will come and attack me, em with banim.

12.verse: But Thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy zera as the chol of the yam, which cannot be numbered for multitude.

13.verse: And he spent there that same night; and took of that which came to his yad a minchah for Esav achiv;

14.verse: Two hundred female goats, and twenty male goats, two hundred rechelim (ewes), and twenty eilim (rams),

15.verse: Thirty nursing gemalim with their colts, forty parot (cows), and ten parim (bulls), twenty female donkeys, and ten male donkeys.

16.verse: And he delivered them into the yad of his avadim, every herd by itself; and said unto his avadim, Pass over before me, and keep a space between herd and herd.

17.verse: And he commanded the rishon, saying, When Esav achi meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? And to where goest thou? And whose are these [animals] before thee?

18.verse: Then thou shalt say, They are of thy eved Ya’akov; it is a minchah sent unto adoni Esav; and, hinei, also he is behind us.

19.verse: And so commanded he the second, and the third, and all that followed the adarim (herds), saying, On this manner shall ye speak unto Esav, when ye find him.

20.verse: And say ye moreover, Hinei, thy eved Ya’akov is behind us. For he said, Akhapperah (I will appease, pacify) his face with the minchah that goeth ahead of me, and afterward I will see his face; perhaps he will accept me.

21.verse: So went the minchah (present) over ahead of him; but he himself stayed balailah in the machaneh.

22.verse: And he rose up that night, and took his two nashim and his two shifchot, and his eleven yeladim, and passed over the ma’avar (ford) Yabbok.

23.verse: And he took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over [all] that he had.

24.verse: And Ya’akov was left by himself; and there wrestled an ish with him until the shachar (dawn, sunup).

25.verse: And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he struck his hip socket; so Ya’akov’s hip socket dislocated while he wrestled with him.

26.verse: And he said, Let me go, for shachar breaketh. And he said, I will not let thee go, unless thou make a berakah upon me.

27.verse: And he said unto him, What is shemecha? And he said, Ya’akov.

28.verse: And he said, Shimcha shall be called no more Ya’akov, but Yisroel: for sarita im Elohim ([yisrah=to prevail + El=G-d = Yisroel] ye have striven with Elohim) and with anashim, and hast overcome.

29.verse: And Ya’akov asked him, and said, Tell me, now, shemecha. And he said, Why is it that thou dost ask after shmi? And he made a brocha upon him there.

30.verse: And Ya’akov called the shem of the makom (place) Peniel [Face of G-d): for I have seen Elohim panim el panim, and my nefesh is saved.

31.verse: And as he passed over Penuel the shemesh rose upon him, and he limped upon his hip.

32.verse: Therefore the Bnei Yisroel eat not of the sinew of the thigh vein (sciatic nerve) which is upon the hip socket, unto this day; because he touched the hip socket of Ya’akov in the sinew of the thigh vein.

1.verse: And Ya’akov lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, hinei, Esav came, and with him arba me’ot ish (four hundred men). And he divided the yeladim unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two shefachot.

2.verse: And he put the shefachot and their yeladim rishonah, and Leah and her yeladim acharonim, and Rachel and Yosef acharonim.

3.verse: And he passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground sheva pe’amim, until he came near to achiv (his brother).

4.verse: And Esav ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his tzavar (neck), and kissed him; and they wept.

5.verse: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the nashim and the yeladim; and said, Who are those with thee? And he said, The yeladim which Elohim hath graciously given thy eved.

6.verse: Then the shefachot came near, they and their yeladim, and they bowed themselves.

7.verse: And Leah also with her yeladim came near, and bowed themselves; and after came Yosef near and Rachel, and they bowed themselves.

8.verse: And he said, What meanest thou by all this machaneh which I met? And he said, These are to find chen (grace) in the eyes of adoni.

9.verse: And Esav said, I have enough, achi (my brother); keep that thou hast unto thyself.

10.verse: And Ya’akov said, No, now, if I have found chen (grace) in thy sight, then receive my minchah at my yad inasmuch as I have seen thy face, as though I had seen the p’nei Elohim (the face of G-d) vatirtzeini (and thou wast pleased to accept me, thou wast appeased by me).

11.verse: Accept, now, my brocha that is brought to thee; because Elohim hath dealt graciously with me, and because yesh li khol (there is to me all, my needs are met). And he urged him, and he accepted.

12.verse: And he said, Nise’ah (let us take our journey), and let us go, I will go next to thee.

13.verse: And he said unto him, Adoni knoweth that the yeladim are tender and the nursing tzon and bakar are upon me; and if men should overdrive them yom echad, all the tzon will die.

14.verse: Let now adoni, pass over before his eved; and I will lead on slowly, according to the pace of the drove that goeth before me and the pace the yeladim are able to endure, until I come unto adoni at Seir.

15.verse: And Esav said, Let me now leave with thee some of HaAm that are with me. And he said, What needeth it? Let me find chen in the sight of adoni.

16.verse: So Esav returned that day on his derech unto Seir.

17.verse: And Ya’akov journeyed to Sukkot, and built him a bais, and made sukkot for his mikneh; therefore the shem of the makom is called Sukkot.

18.verse: And Ya’akov came shalem to Ir Shechem, which is in eretz Kena’an, when he came from Padan Aram; and encamped before the Ir.

19.verse: And he bought a chelkat hasadeh (piece of land), where he had pitched there his ohel, from the yad Bnei Chamor Avi Shechem, for a hundred pieces of kesitah (money).

20.verse: And he erected there a Mizbe’ach, and called it El Elohei Yisroel.

1.verse: And Dinah Bat Leah, which she bore unto Ya’akov, went out to see the Banot HaAretz.

2.verse: And when Shechem Ben Chamor the Chivvi (Hivite), Nasi HaAretz, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and violated her.

3.verse: And his nefesh had deveykus unto Dinah Bat Ya’akov, and he loved the na’arah, and spoke to the lev hanaarah.

4.verse: And Shechem spoke unto Chamor aviv, saying, Get me this yaldah as isha.

5.verse: And Ya’akov heard that he had made his bat Dinah tameh; now his banim were with his mikneh in the sadeh; and Ya’akov held his peace until they were come.

6.verse: And Chamor avi Shechem went out unto Ya’akov to speak with him.

7.verse: And the Bnei Ya’akov came from the sadeh when they heard it; and the anashim were grieved, and they were in wrath greatly, because he had wrought nevalah (folly, disgrace, outrage) against Yisroel in lying with Bat Ya’akov; which thing ought not to be done.

8.verse: And Chamor spoke with them, saying, The nefesh of beni (my son) Shechem longeth for your bat; now give her him as isha.

9.verse: So intermarry with us, and give your banot unto us, and take benoteinu (our banot) unto you.

10.verse: And ye shall dwell with us; and HaAretz shall be before you; dwell and trade therein, and get you possessions therein.

11.verse: And Shechem said unto her av and unto her achim, Let me find chen (grace) in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.

12.verse: Ask me never so much mohar (bride price, dowry) and mattan (gift), and I will pay according as ye shall say unto me; but give me the na’arah as isha.

13.verse: And the Bnei Ya’akov answered Shechem and Chamor aviv in mirmar (deceit) and spoke because he had made Dinah their achot tameh;

14.verse: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give achoteinu (our sister) to ish that is arelah (uncircumcised); for that would be a cherpah (reproach, disgrace) unto us;

15.verse: But in this will we consent unto you: If ye will become like us, that every zachar of you be circumcised;

16.verse: Then will we give benoteinu unto you, and we will take your banot to us, and we will dwell among you, and we will become as Am Echad.

17.verse: But if ye will not pay heed unto us, to become circumcised; then will we take biteinu (our daughter), and we will go.

18.verse: And their words pleased Chamor, and Shechem Ben Chamor.

19.verse: And the na’ar deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Bat Ya’akov; and he was more respected than kol Bais Aviv.

20.verse: And Chamor and Shechem bno came unto the Sha’ar of their city, and they spoke with the anashim of their city, saying,

21.verse: These anashim are shlemim (peaceable) with us; therefore let them settle in HaAretz, and let them trade therein for HaAretz, hinei, it is plenty of room for them; let us take their banot to us as nashim, and let us give them benoteinu.

22.verse: Only herein will the anashim consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be Am Echad, if every zachar among us be circumcised, just as they are nimolim (ones being circumcised).

23.verse: Shall not their mikneh and their property and every behemah of theirs be ours? Only let us consent unto them, and they will settle among us.

24.verse: And unto Chamor and unto Shechem bno paid heed all that went out of the Sha’ar of his city; and every zachar was circumcised, all that went out of the Sha’ar of his city.

25.verse: And it came to pass on the Yom HaShlishi, when they were in pain, that two of the Bnei Ya’akov, Shimon and Levi, achei Dinah, took each ish his cherev, and came upon the Ir betach (boldly, confidently), and they slaughtered kol zachar.

26.verse: And they slaughtered Chamor and Shechem bno with the edge of the cherev, and took Dinah from the Bais Shechem and left.

27.verse: The Bnei Ya’akov came upon the chalalim (dead ones, slain ones), and plundered the Ir, because they had made their achot tameh.

28.verse: They seized their tzon, and their bakar, and their chamorim, and that which was in the Ir, and that which was in the sadeh,

29.verse: And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their nashim they carried off and plundered even all that was in the bais.

30.verse: And Ya’akov said to Shimon and Levi, Ye have brought trouble on me to make me a stench among the inhabitants of HaAretz, among the Kena’ani and the Perizzi; and I being few in mispar, they shall gather themselves together against me, and attack me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my bais.

31.verse: And they said, Should he deal with achoteinu like with zonah?

1.verse: And Elohim said unto Ya’akov, Arise, go up to Beit-El, and settle there; and make there a Mizbe’ach unto El (G-d) that appeared unto thee when thou didst flee from the face of Esav achicha.

2.verse: Then Ya’akov said unto his Bais, and to all that were with him, Put away the elohei hanekhar that are among you, and be tahor, and change your simlah (garments);

3.verse: And let us arise, and go up to Beit-El; and I will build there a Mizbe’ach unto El (G-d) Who answered me in my yom tzoros, and was with me in the derech in which I went.

4.verse: And they gave unto Ya’akov kol elohei hanekhar which were in their yad, and all their nezamim which were in their oznayim; and Ya’akov buried them under the elah (terebinth) which was at Shechem.

5.verse: And they journeyed; and the chittat Elohim (terror of G-d) was upon the cities that were around them, and they did not pursue after the Bnei Ya’akov.

6.verse: So Ya’akov came to Luz, which is in Eretz Kena’an, that is, Beit-El, he and kol haAm that were with him.

7.verse: And he built there a Mizbe’ach, and called the makom (place) El Beit-El; because there HaElohim appeared unto him, when he fled from the face of achiv.

8.verse: But Devorah meineket Rivkah died, and she was buried under an alon (oak) below Beit-El; and shmo was called Alon Bachut.

9.verse: And Elohim appeared unto Ya’akov again, when he returned from Padan Aram, and made a brocha upon him.

10.verse: And Elohim said unto him, Shimcha is Ya’akov; shimcha shall not be called any more Ya’akov, but Yisroel shall be shemecha; and He called shmo Yisroel.

11.verse: And Elohim said unto him, I am El Shaddai; be fruitful and multiply; a Goy (nation) and a Kehal Goyim shall be from thee, and Melechim shall come out of thy loins;

12.verse: And HaAretz which I gave Avraham and Yitzchak, to thee I will give it, and to thy zera after thee will I give HaAretz.

13.verse: And Elohim went up from him in the makom where He talked with him.

14.verse: And Ya’akov set up a matzevah (pillar, monument) in the makom where He talked with him, even a matzevat even (pillar of stone); and he poured a nesech (drink offering) thereon, and he poured shemen (oil) thereon.

15.verse: And Ya’akov called the shem of the makom where Elohim spoke with him, Beit- El.

16.verse: And they journeyed from Beit-El; and there was still a space of ha’aretz to get to Ephratah; and Rachel travailed, and she had hard labor.

17.verse: And it came to pass, when she was in hard labor, that the meyaledet (midwife) said unto her, Fear not; thou shalt have this ben also.

18.verse: And it came to pass, as her nefesh was in departing, (for she died) that she called shmo Ben-Oni (Son of Affliction); but aviv called him Binyamin.

19.verse: And Rachel died, and was buried on the derech to Ephratah, which is Beit- Lechem.

20.verse: And Ya’akov set up a matzevah upon her kever; that is matzevet kevurat Rachel to this day.

21.verse: And Yisroel journeyed, and pitched his ohel beyond Migdal-Eder.

22.verse: And it came to pass, when Yisroel dwelt in that land, that Reuven went and lay with Bilhah pilegesh aviv and Yisroel heard it. Now the Bnei Ya’akov were Sheneym Asar (Twelve);

23.verse: The Bnei Leah: Reuven bechor Ya’akov, and Shimon, and Levi, and Yehudah, and Yissakhar, and Zevulun;

24.verse: The Bnei Rachel: Yosef, and Binyamin;

25.verse: And the Bnei Bilhah shifchat Rachel: Dan, and Naphtali;

26.verse: And the Bnei Zilpah shifchat Leah: Gad, and Asher; these are the Bnei Ya’akov, which were born to him in Padan Aram.

27.verse: And Ya’akov came unto Yitzchak Aviv unto Mamre, unto Kiriat HaArba, which is Chevron, where Avraham and Yitzchak sojourned.

28.verse: And the days of Yitzchak were me’at shanah u’shemonim shanah.

29.verse: And Yitzchak expired, and died, and was gathered unto his people, being zaken (old) and full of yamim; and his banim Esav and Ya’akov buried him.

1.verse: Now these are the toldot Esav, who is Edom.

2.verse: Esav took his nashim of the Banot Kena’an: Adah Bat Elon the Chitti, and Oholivamah Bat Anah Bat Tziveon the Chivvi;

3.verse: And Basemat Bat Yishma’el, achot Nevayot.

4.verse: And Adah bore to Esav Eliphaz; and Basemat bore Reuel;

5.verse: And Oholivamah bore Yeush, and Ya’alam, and Korach; these are the Bnei Esav, which were born unto him in Eretz Kena’an.

6.verse: And Esav took his nashim, and his banim, and his banot, and kol nafshot of his bais, and his mikneh, and all his behemah, and all his possessions, which he had acquired in Eretz Kena’an; and went into the eretz from the face of Ya’akov achiv.

7.verse: For their wealth was more than that they might dwell together; and the eretz of their sojourns could not support them because of their mikneh.

8.verse: Thus dwelt Esav in har Seir; Esav is Edom.

9.verse: And these are the toldot Esav avi Edom in har Seir:

10.verse: These are the shemot Bnei Esav; Eliphaz Ben Adah eshet Esav, Reuel Ben Basemat eshet Esav.

11.verse: And the Bnei Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Tzepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

12.verse: And Timna was pilegesh (concubine) to Eliphaz Ben Esav; and she bore to Eliphaz Amalek; these were the Bnei Adah eshet Esav.

13.verse: And these are the Bnei Reuel: Nachat, and Zerach, Shammah, and Mizzah; these were the Bnei Basemat eshet Esav.

14.verse: And these were the Bnei Oholivamah Bat Anah Bat Tziveon, eshet Esav: and she bore to Esav Yeush, and Yaalam, and Korach.

15.verse: These were alufei (chiefs) of the Bnei Esav: the Bnei Eliphaz the bechor Esav; aluf (chief) Teman, aluf Omar, aluf Tzepho, aluf Kenaz,

16.verse: Aluf (chief) Korach, aluf (chief) Gatam, and aluf (chief) Amalek; these are the alufei Eliphaz in Eretz Edom; these were the Bnei Adah.

17.verse: And these are the Bnei Reuel Ben Esav: aluf (chief) Nachat, aluf Zerach, aluf Shammah, aluf Mizzah; these are the alufei Reuel in Eretz Edom; these are the Bnei Basemat eshet Esav.

18.verse: And these are the Bnei Oholivamah eshet Esav: aluf (chief) Yeush, aluf Yaalam, aluf Korach; these were the alufei Oholivamah Bat Anah eshet Esav.

19.verse: These are the Bnei Esav, who is Edom, and these are their alufim (chiefs).

20.verse: These are the Bnei Seir the Chori, who inhabited HaAretz: Lotan, and Shoval, and Tziveon, and Anah,

21.verse: And Dishon, and Etzer, and Dishan; these are the alufei HaChori, the Bnei Seir in Eretz Edom.

22.verse: And the Bnei Lotan were Chori and Hemam; and achot Lotan was Timna.

23.verse: And the Bnei Shoval were these: Alvan, and Manachat, and Eval, Shepho, and Onam.

24.verse: And these are the Bnei Tziveon: both Ayyah, and Anah; this was that Anah that found the mules in the midbar, as he pastured the chamorim of Tziveon aviv.

25.verse: And the Bnei Anah were these: Dishon, and Oholivamah Bat Anah.

26.verse: And these are the Bnei Dishon: Chemdan, and Eshban, and Yitran, and Keran.

27.verse: The Bnei Etzer are these: Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Akan.

28.verse: The Bnei Dishan are these: Uz, and Aran.

29.verse: These are the alufei (chiefs) haChori: aluf (chief) Lotan, aluf Shoval, aluf Tziveon, aluf Anah,

30.verse: Aluf Dishon, aluf Etzer, aluf (chief) Dishan; these are the alufei haChori by their alufim (chiefs) in Eretz Seir.

31.verse: And these are the melechim that reigned in Eretz Edom, before there reigned any melech over the Bnei Yisroel.

32.verse: And Bela Ben Be’or reigned in Edom; and the shem of his city was Dinhavah.

33.verse: And Bela died, and Yovav Ben Zerach of Botzrah reigned in his place.

34.verse: And Yovav died, and Chusham of Eretz Temani reigned in his place.

35.verse: And Chusham died, and Hadad Ben Bedad, who defeated Midyan in the sadeh of Moav, reigned in his place; and the shem of his city was Avit.

36.verse: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.

37.verse: And Samlah died, and Sha’ul of Rechovot-nahar reigned in his place.

38.verse: And Sha’ul died, and Baal Chanan Ben Achbor reigned in his place.

39.verse: And Baal Chanan Ben Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his place; and the shem of his city was Pau; and the shem of his isha was Mehetavel Bat Matred Bat Mei Zahav.

40.verse: And these are the shemot of the alufei Esav, according to their mishpechot, after their mekomot, by their shemot: aluf (chief) Timnah, aluf (chief) Alvah, aluf (chief) Yetet,

41.verse: Aluf Oholivamah, aluf (chief) Elah, aluf (chief) Pinon,

42.verse: Aluf (chief) Kenaz, aluf (chief) Teman, aluf (chief) Mivtzar,

43.verse: Aluf (chief) Magdiel, aluf (chief) Iram; these are the alufei Edom, according to their moshavot in the eretz of their achuzzah; this is Esav Avi Edom.

1.verse: [VAYESHEV] - And Ya’akov dwelt in the eretz megurei Aviv (in the land wherein his father was a ger) in Eretz Canaan.

2.verse: These are the toldot Ya’akov. Yosef, being seventeen years old, was ro’eh with his achim to the tzon; now the na’ar was with the bnei Bilhah, and with the bnei Zilpah, the ne’shei Aviv (the wives of his father); and Yosef brought unto Avihem (their father) dibbatam ra’ah (a bad, evil report of them).

3.verse: Now Yisroel loved Yosef more than all his children, because he was the ben zekunim (the son of his old age); and he made him a kesones passim (ketonet [tunic] reaching to palms and soles, [see Messianic significance Yn 19:23 OJBC]).

4.verse: And when his achim saw that Avihem loved him more than all his achim, they hated him, and could not speak with shalom unto him.

5.verse: And Yosef dreamed a chalom (dream [see Mt 2:22 OJBC]), and he told it to his achim; and they hated him yet the more.

6.verse: And he said unto them, Hear, now, this chalom which I have dreamed:

7.verse: For, hinei, we were binding alummim (sheaves of wheat) out in the sadeh, and, hinei, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, hinei, your alummot (sheaves of wheat) gathered around it, and bowed down to my sheaf.

8.verse: And his achim said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? Or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? And they hated him yet the more for his chalomot (dreams), and for his devarim.

9.verse: And he dreamed yet another chalom, and told it his achim, and said, Hinei, I have dreamed a chalom more; and, hinei, the shemesh and the yarei’ach and the eleven kokhavim bowed down to me.

10.verse: And he told it to Aviv, and to his achim: and Aviv rebuked him, and said unto him, What is this chalom that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and Immecha and Achecha indeed come to bow down ourselves to the ground before thee?

11.verse: And his achim had kina (jealousy, envy) toward him; but Aviv was shomer over the saying.

12.verse: And his achim went for the purpose to be ro’eh tzon Avihem in the vicinity of Shechem.

13.verse: And Yisroel said unto Yosef, Do not thy achim ro’im in Shechem? Come and I will send thee unto them. And he said to him, Hineni.

14.verse: And he said to him, Go, now, see about the shalom achecha, and the shalom hatzon; and bring me devar. So he sent him out of the Emek Chevron, and he went to Shechem.

15.verse: And a certain ish found him, and, hinei, he was wandering in the sadeh; and the ish asked him, saying, What seekest thou?

16.verse: And he said, I seek my achim; tell me, now, where they ro’im (feed their flocks).

17.verse: And the ish said, They are departed from here; for I heard them say, Let us go to Dotan. And Yosef went after his achim, and found them in Dotan.

18.verse: And when they saw him merachok (afar off, in the distance), even before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to kill him.

19.verse: And they said one to another, Hinei, this ba’al hachalomot cometh.

20.verse: Come now therefore, and let us kill him, and throw him into one of the borot (pits), and we will say, Some chayyah ra’ah (evil wild beast) hath devoured him; and we shall see what will become of his chalomot.

21.verse: And Reuven heard it, and he saved him out of their yadayim; and said, Let us not take his nefesh.

22.verse: And Reuven said unto them, Do no shefach dahm (shedding of blood), but throw him into this bor that is in the midbar, and lay no yad upon him; that he might rescue him out of their yadayim, to take him back to Aviv.

23.verse: And it came to pass, when Yosef was come unto his achim, that they stripped Yosef of his kesones [see Yn 19:23 OJBC], his kesones hapassim that was on him;

24.verse: And they took him, and threw him into the borah (pit); and the bor was empty, there was no mayim in it.

25.verse: And they sat down to eat lechem; and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, hinei, a caravan of Yishm’elim was coming from Gil‘ad with their gemalim bearing spices and balm and myrrh, going to carry it down to Mitzrayim.

26.verse: And Yehudah said unto his achim, What betza (profit, gain) is it if we kill achinu (our brother), and conceal his dahm?

27.verse: Come, and let us sell him to the Yishm’elim, and let not yadeinu (our hands) be upon him; for he is achinu (our brother) and besareinu (our flesh). And his achim agreed.

28.verse: Then there passed by anashim Midyanim socharim (men of Midyan, traders); and they drew and lifted up Yosef out of the bor, and sold Yosef to the Yishm’elim for esrim kesef; and they took Yosef to Mitzrayim.

29.verse: And Reuven returned unto the bor; and, hinei, Yosef was not in the bor; and he made the keriah of his clothes [compare Mk 14:63 OJBC].

30.verse: And he returned unto his achim, and said, The yeled is not; and I, where shall I turn?

31.verse: And they took the kesones Yosef, and did shachat the se’ir izzim (slaughtered the kid of the goats), and dipped the kesones in the dahm;

32.verse: And they sent the kesones hapassim, and they brought it to Avihem; and said, This have we found; examine for identification purposes now whether it be the kesones Binecha or no.

33.verse: And he recognized it, and said, It is the kesones beni; a chayyah ra’ah hath devoured him; Yosef is without doubt torn in pieces.

34.verse: And Ya’akov made the keriah of his clothes, and put sackcloth on his loins, and mourned for beno yamim rabbim.

35.verse: And all his banim and all his banot rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down to beni mourning to Sheol. Thus Aviv wept for him.

36.verse: And the Midyanim sold him into Mitzrayim unto Potiphar, a seris Pharaoh (courtier of Pharaoh), a sar hatabbachim (a captain of the slaughterers, executioners, i.e., captain of the guard).

1.verse: And it came to pass at that time, that Yehudah went down from his achim, and turned in to an ish Adulami shmo Chirah.

2.verse: And Yehudah saw there a bat ish Kena’ani shmo Shua; and he took her, and went in unto her.

3.verse: She conceived, and bore ben; and he called shmo Er.

4.verse: And she conceived again, and bore ben; and she called shmo Onan.

5.verse: And she yet again conceived, and bore ben; and called shmo Shelah; at Keziv, when she bore him.

6.verse: And Yehudah took a wife for Er his bechor, whose shem was Tamar.

7.verse: And Er, bechor Yehudah, was rah in the eyes of Hashem; and Hashem slaughtered him.

8.verse: And Yehudah said unto Onan, Go in unto eshet achicha, and enter into levirate marriage with her, and raise up zera to achicha.

9.verse: And Onan knew that the zera should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto eshet achiv, that he spilled it on the ground, lest he should give zera to achiv.

10.verse: And the thing which he did was rah in the eyes of Hashem; therefore He slaughtered him also.

11.verse: Then said Yehudah to Tamar his kallah, Remain an almanah at thy bais avi, till Shelah beni is grown; for he said, Lest he die also, as his achim did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her bais avi.
